oai_dc:dc.dc:title: MODELLING OF A THREE-LAYER SEDIMENT TRANSPORT SYSTEM IN OSCILLATORY FLOW
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kaczmarek, Leszek M.
Ostrowski, Rafal
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: sediment transport
oscillatory flow
3D transport
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An extension of the bedload model of Kaczmarek & Ostrowski (1996), taking account of suspended sediment, is proposed for the calculation of sediment transport features, such as the transport rate and thickness. The paper is focused on the transition region (named as a contact load layer) between the outer region (suspension layer) and the bedload layer within the proposed three-layer sediment transport model.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 26 (1998): Proceedings of 26th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Copenhagen, Denmark, 1998.
